name: Liberty Leading the People
description: Commemorates the July Revolution of 1830, showing the spirit of French liberty.

name: The Siege of La Rochelle
description: Depicts Cardinal Richelieu directing the siege of La Rochelle (1627–1628), a decisive moment in the consolidation of royal power under Louis XIII.

name: The Death of Marat
description: A martyr portrait of the French revolutionary Jean-Paul Marat.

name: Oath of the Horatii
description: A neoclassical masterpiece depicting Roman virtue and sacrifice.

name: La Grande Odalisque
description: An orientalist fantasy that challenged classical proportions.

name: The Raft of the Medusa
description: A powerful critique of French politics through a shipwreck disaster.

name: Starry Night Over the Rhone
description: Painted in Arles, France, capturing the night sky over the Rhone river.

name: Napoleon Crossing the Alps
description: Iconic propagandistic portrait of Napoleon leading his army through the Alpine pass toward Italy.

name: The Coronation of Napoleon
description: Monumental depiction of Napoleon’s coronation ceremony at Notre-Dame in Paris, emphasizing imperial grandeur.

name: Bonaparte Visiting the Plague Victims of Jaffa
description: Dramatic Napoleonic-era painting portraying Bonaparte as fearless and compassionate during the Egyptian campaign.

name: Napoleon at the Bridge of Arcole
description: Energetic image of Bonaparte carrying the flag during the Italian campaign, turning battle into legend.

name: Napoleon on the Battlefield of Eylau
description: A grand scene blending battlefield horror and imperial mercy after the Battle of Eylau (1807).

name: Cardinal Richelieu
description: A defining portrait of the powerful French statesman and cardinal, embodying authority and political discipline.

name: Triple Portrait of Cardinal Richelieu
description: Richelieu shown from three angles, likely used as a study for sculpture and as a statement of omnipresent power.

name: Portrait of Louis XIV
description: The ultimate royal image: Louis XIV in coronation robes, turning monarchy into theater and brand.

name: Equestrian Portrait of Charles I
description: Painted at the French court’s artistic orbit, this influential equestrian portrait helped define royal imagery in Europe.

name: Portrait of Madame Recamier
description: Elegant salon icon reclining in severe neoclassical calm, capturing the style and politics of post-Revolution Paris.

name: Madame Recamier
description: An alternative vision of the same famous sitter, with cool poise and linear refinement typical of Ingres.

name: The Execution of Lady Jane Grey
description: French Romantic history painting that popularized tragic royal drama with theatrical lighting and emotion.

name: Napoleon’s Farewell at Fontainebleau
description: A sentimental retelling of Napoleon’s farewell to the Imperial Guard, feeding 19th-century Napoleonic memory.

name: The Angelus
description: Two peasants pause for prayer at dusk, a rural icon of 19th-century France and the dignity of labor.

name: The Gleaners
description: A landmark Realist painting showing women collecting leftover grain, quietly political through everyday reality.

name: Luncheon on the Grass
description: Scandalous modern scene that shocked the Salon system and helped ignite modern art in France.

name: Olympia
description: A confrontational modern nude that challenged academic conventions and forced Paris to argue about art.

name: Impression, Sunrise
description: The painting that gave Impressionism its name, capturing Le Havre’s harbor in flickering atmosphere.

name: Dance at Le Moulin de la Galette
description: A joyful slice of Parisian life in Montmartre, painted with shimmering light and movement.

name: A Bar at the Folies-Bergere
description: A modern Paris nightlife scene with a mirror puzzle, blending glamour, alienation, and social observation.

name: Mont Sainte-Victoire (series)
description: Cezanne’s repeated studies of the Provençal mountain became a bridge from Impressionism to modern structure.

name: A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte
description: Pointillist masterpiece turning leisure into geometry and optical science on the banks of the Seine.

name: At the Moulin Rouge
description: A Belle Epoque nightlife portrait of Paris, capturing the sharp glow and strange psychology of cabaret society.
